item.rel_title: Breadth of concomitant immune responses underpinning viral clearance and patient recovery in a non-severe case of COVID-19
item.rel_abs: We report the kinetics of the immune response in relation to clinical and virological features of a patient with mild-to-moderate coronavirus disease-19 (COVID-19) requiring hospitalisation. Increased antibody-secreting cells, follicular T-helper cells, activated CD4+ and CD8+ T-cells and IgM/IgG SARS-CoV-2-binding antibodies were detected in blood, prior to symptomatic recovery. These immunological changes persisted for at least 7 days following full resolution of symptoms, indicating substantial anti-viral immunity in this non-severe COVID-19.
item.rel_authors: Thevarajan, I.; Nguyen, T. H.; Koutsakos, M.; Druce, J.; Caly, L.; van de Sandt, C. E.; Jia, X.; Nicholson, S.; Catton, M.; Cowie, B.; Tong, S.; Lewin, S.; Kedzierska, K.
